timeline.message:
Use Lombok for RequestContext

- Simplify RequestContext by using Lombok.
- Remove deprecated X-GP-DATA-FRAGMENT, use X-GP-FRAGMENT-INDEX instead.

Use Lombok for RequestContext

- Simplify RequestContext by using Lombok.
- Remove deprecated X-GP-DATA-FRAGMENT, use X-GP-FRAGMENT-INDEX instead.

timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: I do not want to make any changes that will impact other classes. This will make us change getters for accessor, fragmenter, resolver.
replies.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyText: nice, even though we technically do not need  @RequiredArgsConstructor that comes with it. Any way to suppress it ?
timeline.author: denalex
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,6 +40,7 @@
  * Common configuration available to all PXF plugins. Represents input data
  * coming from client applications, such as GPDB.
  */
+@Data

replies.bodyText: good catch, I'll replace it with @Getter @Setter.
replies.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyText: so this was not used at all ? the write case would not have any fragments, default will change from -1 to 0, hopefully no existing logic impact ?
timeline.author: denalex
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -63,25 +68,101 @@ public void setRequestType(RequestType requestType) {
     }
 
     // ----- NAMED PROPERTIES -----
+
+    /**
+     * The fully-qualified class name for the java class that was defined as
+     * Accessor.
+     */
     private String accessor;
+
+    /**
+     * The aggregate type, i.e - count, min, max, etc
+     */
     private EnumAggregationType aggType;
+
+    /**
+     * The name of the server configuration for this request.
+     */
+    @Setter(AccessLevel.NONE)
     private String config;
+
+    /**
+     * The server configuration associated to the server that this request is
+     * accessing
+     */
     private Configuration configuration;
-    private int dataFragment = -1; /* should be deprecated */

replies.bodyText:
this was not used at all, but we had the same information here:
https://github.com/greenplum-db/pxf/pull/515/files#diff-f4bcdfde3d8615e2a52da19be244339ca0e9b457df836d33d469f9a01a0d5148L228
https://github.com/greenplum-db/pxf/pull/515/files#diff-f4bcdfde3d8615e2a52da19be244339ca0e9b457df836d33d469f9a01a0d5148L226
replies.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyText: should this be transient to exclude from toString / hashcode methods ?
timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: these should not be included anymore after I remove @Data and use @Getter, @Setter instead.
replies.author: frankgh

timeline.author: denalex
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -94,15 +175,46 @@ public void setRequestType(RequestType requestType) {
      */
     private int numAttrsProjected;

+     * The plugin configuration
+     */

replies.bodyText: no idea, but I did not remove them, maybe we should clean up some of this code at some point

      */

+    /**

+     * user set it to an empty string this function will return null.
+     */

-    private String resolver;
+
+    /**

      * The name of the server to access. The name will be used to build
-     * a path for the config files (i.e. $PXF_BASE/servers/$serverName/*.xml)

timeline.message: Also apply ET change to FDW
